Parameter.Title: Over Current Protection
Parameter.Description: Output load will be closed after 30 seconds if the current sxceeds 10.5A 0 – Disabled 1 – Enabled

Parameter.Title: Over Heat Protection
Parameter.Description: Output load will be closed after 30 seconds if the temperature sxceeds 100C 0 – Disabled 1 – Enabled

Parameter.Title: Status After Power Up
Parameter.Description: Determines how the device will operate when it is powered up: 0 – Return to the last status when power was lost 1 – Always On 2 – Always Off

Parameter.Title: Enable/Disable the IR sensor of WallSwipe
Parameter.Description:
Combine the values to select the required combination LSB 1 IR Sensor Enablement (0: Disabled, 1:Enabled) 256 Wave Option Selected (0: Option 1, 1: Option 2)
MSB 1 Scene control functionality for Left/Right wave (0: Disabled, 1:Enabled) 256 Scene control functionality for all wave actions (0: Disabled, 1:Enabled)

Parameters.Parameter:
Set the button colour of WallSwipe Defines the Level 1 and the RGB colour MSB: Level 1 - Brightness?
LSB: Define the RGB colour 0xRRGGBB Byte 1: 0-255 – Red 2: 0-255 – Green 3: 0-255 – Blue>

Set the LED indication color of WallSwipe Up Defines the the RGB colour MSB: Reserved do not change of 0x32
LSB: Define the RGB colour 0xRRGGBB Byte 1: 0-255 – Red 2: 0-255 – Green 3: 0-255 – Blue>

Set the LED indication color of WallSwipe Down Defines the the RGB colour MSB: Reserved do not change of 0x32
LSB: Define the RGB colour 0xRRGGBB Byte 1: 0-255 – Red 2: 0-255 – Green 3: 0-255 – Blue>

Set the LED indication color of WallSwipe Left Defines the the RGB colour MSB: Reserved do not change of 0x32
LSB: Define the RGB colour 0xRRGGBB Byte 1: 0-255 – Red 2: 0-255 – Green 3: 0-255 – Blue>

Set the LED indication color of WallSwipe Right Defines the the RGB colour MSB: Reserved do not change of 0x32
LSB: Define the RGB colour 0xRRGGBB Byte 1: 0-255 – Red 2: 0-255 – Green 3: 0-255 – Blue>

Set the color of WallSwipe at Night Defines the the RGB colour MSB: Reserved do not change of Ox0A
LSB: Define the RGB colour 0xRRGGBB Byte 1: 0-255 – Red 2: 0-255 – Green 3: 0-255 – Blue>

Parameter.Title: Set Notification Type
Parameter.Description: Set the type of notifications to be sent 0 – Nothing 1 – Hail CC 2 – Basic Report CC 3 – Hail CC when using external switch to switch the loads

Parameter.Title: External Switch 1 Notification to Association Group 3
Parameter.Description: Set the type of notifications to be sent 0 – Nothing 1 – Basic Set CC

Parameter.Title: External Switch 2 Notification to Association Group 4
Parameter.Description: Set the type of notifications to be sent 0 – Nothing 1 – Basic Set CC

Parameter.Title: Configure state of LED when in 3 modes
Parameter.Description: Defines 0 – Energy Mode - The LED will follow the status of On/Off 1 – Momentary Indicator Mode - When teh state of switch's load changed, the LED will follow the status On/Off of its Load, but the LED will turn off after 5 seconds is there is no switch action 2 – Night Light Mode - The LED will remain ON

Parameter.Title: LED Night Light Mode Scheduler
Parameter.Description:
Defines the ON/OFF time of Night Light mode MSB - Value_1 * 256 + Value_2 Value 1 = ON (Hour) 0-23 (Default 18 - 6pm) Value 2 = ON (Minute) 0-60
LSB - Value_3 * 256 + Value_4 Value 3 = OFF (Hour) 0-23 (Default 08 - 8am) Value 4 = OFF (Minute) 0-60

Parameter.Title: Timer ON time
Parameter.Description:
Defines the ON time for the Output Load MSB - Days of Week 1 - Monday 2 - Tuesday 4 - Wednesday 8 - Thursday 16 - Friday 32 - Saturday 64 - Sunday
256 - Enabled (Off = Disabled)
LSB - Time of Day : Value_3 * 256 + Value_4 Value 3 = OFF (Hour) 0-23 (Default 18 - 6pm) Value 4 = OFF (Minute) 0-60

Parameter.Title: Timer OFF time
Parameter.Description:
Defines the OFF time for the Output Load MSB - Days of Week 1 - Monday 2 - Tuesday 4 - Wednesday 8 - Thursday 16 - Friday 32 - Saturday 64 - Sunday
256 - Enabled (Off = Disabled)
LSB - Time of Day : Value_3 * 256 + Value_4 Value 3 = OFF (Hour) 0-23 (Default 23 - 11pm) Value 4 = OFF (Minute) 0-60

Parameter.Title: Enable/Disable Wattage Movement Based Reporting
Parameter.Description: Enable/Disable parameters 91 and 92 0 – Disabled 1 – Enabled

Parameter.Title: Absolute Wattage Change Trigger
Parameter.Description: Wattage Change to Trigger a Meter Report Range 1-65535 by limited within this config to 1-256

Parameter.Title: Percentage Wattage Change Trigger
Parameter.Description: Percentage Wattage Change to Trigger a Meter Report

Parameter.Title: Reset Report Group Reporting to Default
Parameter.Description: Causes device to reset the values of parameters 101 to 103 to their manufacturer defaults 1 – Perform reset

Parameter.Title: Reports to Report Group 1
Parameter.Description:
Defines the reports made MSB 1 - Volts on Channel 1 2 - Volts on Channel 2 8 - Current on Channel 1 16 - Current on Channel 2
LSB 1 - kWh of all Channels 2 - Watts of all Channels 4 - Volts of all Channels 8 - Current on all Channels 256 - Watts on Channel 1 512 - Watts on Channel 2 2048 - kWh on Channel 1 4096 - kWh on Channel 2

Parameter.Title: Reports to Report Group 2
Parameter.Description:
Defines the reports made MSB 1 - Volts on Channel 1 2 - Volts on Channel 2 8 - Current on Channel 1 16 - Current on Channel 2
LSB 1 - kWh of all Channels 2 - Watts of all Channels 4 - Volts of all Channels 8 - Current on all Channels 256 - Watts on Channel 1 512 - Watts on Channel 2 2048 - kWh on Channel 1 4096 - kWh on Channel 2

Parameter.Title: Reports to Report Group 3
Parameter.Description:
Defines the reports made MSB 1 - Volts on Channel 1 2 - Volts on Channel 2 8 - Current on Channel 1 16 - Current on Channel 2
LSB 1 - kWh of all Channels 2 - Watts of all Channels 4 - Volts of all Channels 8 - Current on all Channels 256 - Watts on Channel 1 512 - Watts on Channel 2 2048 - kWh on Channel 1 4096 - kWh on Channel 2

Parameter.Title: Reset Reporting Time Intervals
Parameter.Description: Causes device to reset the values of parameters 111 to 113 to their manufacturer defaults 1 – Perform reset

Parameter.Title: Reporting Group 1 Time Interval
Parameter.Description: Sets the time interval for Reporting Group 1 in seconds

Parameter.Title: Reporting Group 2 Time Interval
Parameter.Description: Sets the time interval for Reporting Group 2 in seconds

Parameter.Title: Reporting Group 3 Time Interval
Parameter.Description: Sets the time interval for Reporting Group 3 in seconds

Parameter.Title: S1 Switch Mode
Parameter.Description: Defines the switch type connected to S1 0 – Unidientified mode 1 – 2 state switch mode 2 – 3 way switch mode 3 – Momentary/Push switch 4 – Enter automatic identification mode (The blue LED will fast blink)

Parameter.Title: S2 Switch Mode
Parameter.Description: Defines the switch type connected to S2 0 – Unidientified mode 1 – 2 state switch mode 2 – 3 way switch mode 3 – Momentary/Push switch 4 – Enter automatic identification mode (The blue LED will fast blink)

Parameter.Title: S1 Action
Parameter.Description: Defines the action taken when S1 is switched 1 – Switch the output load of itself 2 – Control other node 3 – Switch the output load AND control other nodes

Parameter.Title: S2 Action
Parameter.Description: Defines the action taken when S2 is switched 1 – Switch the output load of itself 2 – Control other node 3 – Switch the output load AND control other nodes

Parameter.Title: 2 State Switch Mode Operation
Parameter.Description: Defines how the device works in 2 State Switch Mode 1 – OFF : S1 is a toggle switch 1 – ON : S1 is an ON/OFF switches (the output load is maintained in sync with the switch) 2 – OFF : S2 is a toggle switch 2 – ON : S2 is an ON/OFF switches (the output load is maintained in sync with the switch)

Parameter.Title: S1/S2 Function Enablement
Parameter.Description: Sets the function of S1/S2 1 – The function of sending NIF - OFF:Disabled ON:Enabled 2 – The function of entering RF power level test mode - OFF:Disabled ON:Enabled 128 – Allow sending NIF or entering RF power level test mode OFF:Disallowed ON:Allowed

Parameter.Title: Control Physical Factory Reset Ability
Parameter.Description: Controls whether the Action button on device, external switches or WallSwipe can be used to perform a factory reset 0 – Not allowed 1 – Allowed
